created_at.description: The date and time the resource was created

duration.description: The duration of the meeting in minutes

early_join_time_minutes.description: The number of minutes that users are allowed to join the meeting early without being kicked out

email_delivery_error_count.description: The number of registrants that have an email delivery error with their invite. The delivery errors are counted as the last invite that was sent to the registrant, so if a registrant previously had a delivery error but not in their most recent invite received, then it does not count towards this field value.

meeting_type.description: The type of meeting. This is usually dependent on the committee(s) associated with the meeting

occurrences.description: Array of meeting occurrences (read-only from platform API)

password.description: Unique, non-guessable, password for the meeting - is needed to join a meeting and is included in invites

platform.description: The platform name of where the meeting is hosted

project_uid.description: The UID of the LF project

public_link.description: The public join URL for participants to join the meeting via the LFX platform (e.g. 'https://zoom-lfx.platform.linuxfoundation.org/meeting/12343245463')

recording_enabled.description: Whether recording is enabled for the meeting

registrant_count.description: The number of registrants for the meeting

restricted.description: The restrictedness of joining the meeting (i.e. is the meeting restricted to only invited users or anyone?)

series_end_date.description: The final end time for the meeting series. For recurring meetings, this is the end time of the last occurrence. For non-recurring meetings, this is the end time of the single meeting (start time + duration). Null if the meeting has no end date (infinite recurrence).

show_meeting_attendees.description: Whether attendees/participants list is visible to other participants

start_time.description: The start time of the meeting in RFC3339 format

title.example: Fugit soluta rerum aut quia voluptatem illum.

transcript_enabled.description: Whether transcription is enabled for the meeting

updated_at.description: The date and time the resource was last updated

visibility.description: The visibility of the meeting's existence to other users

youtube_upload_enabled.description: Whether automatic youtube uploading is enabled for the meeting

PastMeetingSummaryZoomConfig.title: PastMeetingSummaryZoomConfig

meeting_id.description: The ID of the created meeting in Zoom

PastMeetingSummaryZoomConfig.description: Zoom-specific configuration for a past meeting summary

created_at.description: The date and time the resource was created

id.description: The unique identifier for this RSVP

meeting_uid.description: The UID of the meeting this RSVP is for

occurrence_id.description: The ID of the specific occurrence (required for 'single' and 'this_and_following' scopes)

registrant_id.description: The ID of the registrant submitting this RSVP

scope.description: The scope of the RSVP (single occurrence, all occurrences, or this and following)

updated_at.description: The date and time the resource was last updated

end_date_time.description: Select the final date on which the meeting will recur before it is canceled. Cannot be used with 'end_times'. should be in GMT. should be in 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ' format.

end_times.description: Select how many times the meeting should recur before it is canceled. Cannot be used with 'end_date_time'.

monthly_day.description: Use this field only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type '3' to state which day in a month, the meeting should recur. The value range is from 1 to 31. For instance, if you would like the meeting to recur on 23rd of each month, provide '23' as the value of this field and '1' as the value of the 'repeat_interval' field. Instead, if you would like the meeting to recur every three months, on 23rd of the month, change the value of the 'repeat_interval' field to '3'.

monthly_week.description: Use this field only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type '3' to state the week of the month when the meeting should recur. If you use this field, you must also use the 'monthly_week_day' field to state the day of the week when the meeting should recur. '-1' - Last week of the month. 1 - First week of the month. 2 - Second week of the month. 3 - Third week of the month. 4 - Fourth week of the month.

monthly_week_day.description: Use this field only if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type '3' to state a specific day in a week when the monthly meeting should recur. To use this field, you must also use the 'monthly_week' field. 1 - Sunday 2 - Monday 3 - Tuesday 4 - Wednesday 5 - Thursday 6 - Friday 7 - Saturday

repeat_interval.description:
Define the interval at which the meeting should recur. 
For instance, if you would like to schedule a meeting that recurs every two months, 
you must set the value of this field as '2' and the value of the 'type' parameter as '3'. 
For a daily meeting, the maximum interval you can set is '90' days. 
For a weekly meeting the maximum interval that you can set is of '12' weeks. 
For a monthly meeting, there is a maximum of '3' months.

weekly_days.description:
This field is required if you're scheduling a recurring meeting of type '2' to state which day(s) 
of the week the meeting should repeat. The value for this field could be a number between '1' to '7' in string format. 
For instance, if the meeting should recur on Sunday, provide '1' as the value of this field. 
If you would like the meeting to occur on multiple days of a week, you should provide comma separated values for this field. 
For instance, if the meeting should recur on Sundays and Tuesdays provide '1,3' as the value of this field. 
1 - Sunday
2 - Monday
3 - Tuesday
4 - Wednesday
5 - Thursday
6 - Friday
7 - Saturday

committee_uid.description: The UID of the committee if registrant is a committee member

created_at.description: The date and time the resource was created

host.description: If user should have access as a meeting host

occurrence_id.description: The ID of the specific occurrence the user should be invited to. If blank, user is invited to all occurrences

org_is_member.description: Whether the registrant is in an organization that has a membership with the LF. If unknown, don't pass this field; the API will find the value by default

org_is_project_member.description: Whether the registrant is in an organization that has a membership with the project (of the meeting). If unknown, don't pass this field; the API will find the value by default

org_name.example: Assumenda quia dolorum aliquam inventore sed.

updated_at.description: The date and time the resource was last updated
